message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.MA, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with a problem of scheduling multiple sensors transmitting data over a lossy and bandwidth-limited channel to a remote estimator. This problem involves optimization, control, and communication aspects, which are relevant to several subfields of computer science. The use of a Markov decision process formulation suggests that the paper may belong to the subcategories of cs.IT (Information Theory) or cs.SY (Systems and Control). The focus on sensor scheduling and wireless communication suggests that the paper may also belong to the subcategories of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) or cs.MA (Multiagent Systems). Finally, the use of algorithms and heuristics suggests that the paper may belong to the subcategory of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
